title: The Darjeeling Limited
content:
I've juste finished watching the latest Wes Anderson movie, _The Darjeeling Limited_, and was wondering what was the font used for the movie titles, poster and end credit (see attachment). It looks like something between Gotham and Neutraface, but I just can't quite put my finger on it. I'm not really looking for the fancy cutout version used for the titles, but just the general letterform. Can anyone please help me ?

(See the film, by the way, it's true Wes Anderson like we like it. For those who like him, at least)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [darjeeling.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100904172842/http:/typophile.com/files/darjeeling.jpg) | 43.2 KB |
author: Der Kosmonaut

comments.content: What's the tag to include images in a post anyway ? Haven't quite been able to find it in the formatting options...
Nevermind that, just saw the "Insert image" widget on the bottom of the window...

The answer is here:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/36831](http://web.archive.org/web/20100904172842/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36831 "http://www.typophile.com/node/36831")  
Scroll down.

Argh... So I guess that means it's custom made.

Thanks very much anyway. I tried searching the forums but Darjeeling Limited returned no results.
Weird -- the search returns [more than enough results](http://web.archive.org/web/20100904172842/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20darjeeling%20limited). How exactly did you search?
